title: How to Enable and Change Nicknames for Contacts on an iPhone

steps.title: Open your iPhone’s Settings.
steps.content: Open your iPhone’s Settings. This is the grey cog icon. If you don't see Settings, you can find it in the App Library .

steps.title: Tap Apps and select Contacts.
steps.content: Tap Apps and select Contacts . Scroll to the bottom of the Settings menu and tap Apps , then locate Contacts in the C section of the Apps menu. If you're using iOS 17 or earlier, scroll down in the main Settings menu and tap Contacts . You can find this underneath Passwords and Mail .

steps.title: Tap Short Name.
steps.content: Tap Short Name . This is below Display Order .

steps.title: Toggle on "Prefer Nicknames".
steps.content: Toggle on "Prefer Nicknames". Your iPhone will now display the contact's assigned nickname when receiving a call or message from them. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Open the Contacts app.
steps.content: Open the Contacts app. This looks like a grey person icon with colored tabs on the right.

steps.title: Tap on a contact to edit.
steps.content: Tap on a contact to edit. All of your contacts will be listed on the left side of the screen. You can use the search bar to quickly find someone. You can add a new contact if necessary.

steps.title: Tap Edit.
steps.content: Tap Edit . This button is in the upper-right corner of the screen.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap add field.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap add field . This button is right above the Linked Contacts section.

steps.title: Tap Nickname.
steps.content: Tap Nickname . It is located at the bottom of the first group of options in the popup menu. The popup menu will disappear.

steps.title: Tap the "Nickname" field.
steps.content: Tap the "Nickname" field. This is underneath the contact's last name field.

steps.title: Enter a nickname and tap Done.
steps.content: Enter a nickname and tap Done . This is at the top-right corner of the screen. The nickname will replace the contact’s actual name and will appear anytime the contact is displayed during a phone call, text message, or email.

steps.title: Restart your iPhone.
steps.content: Restart your iPhone. If nicknames aren't appearing for a contact, a simple restart may fix it.

steps.title: Toggle on and off "Prefer Nicknames".
steps.content: Toggle on and off "Prefer Nicknames". Return to Settings > Contacts > Short Name . Turn off Prefer Nicknames , and then turn it on again.
